column5: Sorry we do not take Hides anymore ...
Here is a link to other Drop Offs also http://www.hatsforhides.com/depots.htm

I hope they get hats soon.  I truely believe this is why my Father-in-law hunts, for the hat.  As that's all he talks about.  We're going this weekend.  It'll be my first time.  I just hope it's not my hide he's gonna trade for the hat...
I didn't think they liked the hides in a garbage bag (let alone sealed)????? Don't they decompose/rot in plastic? I have always understood that salted if at all possible and in a cardboard box....
they are froze when i get them ...never rot in the freezer
OK, fair enough.  I just know that when you take them in early bow season, they want them in cardborad and salted if possible.
Only problem with salting them it makes a big mess ....blood and water come out fast and i really don't want that mess in my tackle store ..
